result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Theodore Charles Lord Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Theodore Charles Lord Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Theodore Charles Lord Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance.
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Theodore C. Lord, Jr. - #2022009151, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Defendant's Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Theodore C. Lord, Jr. - #2022009151, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Theodore Charles Lord not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and requests additional time to review. Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Theodore Charles Lord in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Theodore Charles Lord in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Theodore Charles Lord appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Effective July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
